title: Shocking moment a 19-year-old girl 'smashes her car into a speeding police car'
text:
A police officer has suffered a serious head injury after the marked police car he was in collided with a hatchback being driven by a 19-year-old female.

The police car was rushing to an emergency job - with its lights flashing and sirens on - along Belmore Road in Punchbowl, southwest Sydney.

At about 1.40pm Saturday the other driver in a hatchback allegedly turned into its path - colliding with the police car before hitting a parked truck.

At about 1.40pm Saturday the driver in a hatchback allegedly turned into its path - colliding with the police car before hitting a parked truck

Two officers were in the car with one suffering a serious head injury and being transported to St George Hospital.

It is believed he is now in a stable condition.

The second officer was not seriously injured but was transported to hospital as a precaution.

The female driver of the other vehicle was not injured.

Nearby residents in Punchbowl rushed to help including the father of the 19-year-old female driver.

'(My daughter) saw the police at the last moment and then she didn't know what to do so she just tried to avoid the police car,' the man told 9 News.

The officers had been on their way to an urgent job at Riverwood when the accident happened.

Campsie Police Area Command are investigating the collision.

Anyone with information about the incident is urged to contact Crimestoppers.

The officers had been on their way to an urgent job at Riverwood when the accident happened
description: A police officer has suffered a serious head injury after the marked police car he was in was allegedly hit by a 19-year-old female driver. in Punchbowl, southwest Sydney.
authors: Brett Lackey For Daily Mail Australia
